name: Pelargonium
description: Pelargonium, commonly known as Geranium, is a genus of about 250 species, as well as many hybrids and cultivars. The genus belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is native to South Africa, Australia and the Middle East. The genus includes annuals and perennials, shrubs and subshrubs, succulents, and both evergreen and deciduous species.Pelargoniums come in a variety of sizes, shapes and colors. They are prized for their versatility and colorful flowers which are often bi-colored with decorative stripes. They are great for containers, baskets or trailing down over balconies.
meaning: The genus name comes from the Greek word “pelargos”, which means “stork”, which alludes to the resemblance of the shape of the fruit to the beak of a stork.
color_description: The flowers come in shades of red, purple, orange, pink and white, with many bicolored combinations.
